articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Syrian rebel leader Ahmad al-Sharaa - better known as Abu Mohammed al-Golani - told Reuters in a written statement on Wednesday that he would dissolve the security forces of the toppled regime of Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Exclusive: Syrian rebel leader says he will dissolve toppled regime forces, close prisons

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy criticised Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban on Wednesday for discussing Ukraine in a phone call with Russian leader Vladimir Putin.
articles.title: Zelenskiy criticises Orban over phone call with Putin to discuss Ukraine

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Refugees from Syria's long civil war were making their way home on Wednesday, as a new interim prime minister said he had been appointed with the backing of the rebels who toppled President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Refugees return to Syria as caretaker prime minister appointed

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Haiti's government on Wednesday celebrated the reopening of the capital's Toussaint Louverture International Airport, shut since last month, even as the U.S. aviation watchdog extended a ban on U.S. airlines flying there.
articles.title: Haiti reopens capital's airport as US extends airline ban

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will undergo a brain procedure on Thursday morning to complement the surgery he went through this week, the hospital said on Wednesday in a medical update that stressed he was doing well.
articles.title: Brazil's Lula to undergo second brain procedure in Sao Paulo

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's top aides were heading to the Middle East on Wednesday seeking to advance efforts to reach an elusive Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal and help ensure a smooth transition in Syria following the overthrow of Bashar al-Assad.
articles.title: Top Biden aides heading to Mideast for talks on Syria, Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Pentagon said on Wednesday that there was no evidence that drones that had been spotted over New Jersey were from a foreign entity or adversary and dismissed a claim by a U.S. lawmaker that they were being launched from an Iranian "mothership."
articles.title: No Iranian drone 'mothership' off the United States launching drones, Pentagon says

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: FBI Director Chris Wray will step down from his post early next year, the bureau said on Wednesday, after Republican President-elect Donald Trump signaled his intent to fire the veteran official and replace him with firebrand Kash Patel.
articles.title: FBI Director Chris Wray to resign following Trump nomination of Patel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Beset by weeks of protests by students over a deadly train station disaster last month, Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic acted on Wednesday to defuse the unrest by pledging to meet all their demands.
articles.title: Serbia's Vucic promises to meet protesters' demands after train station disaster

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Brazil's President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will undergo a new medical procedure scheduled for Thursday in order to prevent further bleeding in his brain, newspaper Folha de S. Paulo reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: Brazil's Lula to undergo new procedure to prevent further brain bleeding, local media says
